required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacological Intervention in Insulin Resistance Targeting Autonomic Nerve Activity
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacological Intervention in Insulin Resistance Targeting Autonomic Nerve Activity - a Concept Study in Mani

brief_summary.textblock: The present study on pharmacological intervention in autonomic nervous dysregulation(parasympathetic dysfunction,) regarding insulin resistance, is a concept testing in humans tohelp identify potential new pharmacological target sites in the central nervous system.

primary_outcome.measure: Study the effect of anticholinergic drugs on insulin sensitivity by assessment of glucose infusion rate during hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp.
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Insulin bolus, following will be measured; p-glucose (every 5 minutes), blood samples (every 30 minutes), pulse (every 5 minutes the first hour then every 10 minutes), blood pressure will be measured (the same as pulse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Study the effect of cholinergic stimulation on insulin sensitivity by assessment ofglucose infusion rate during hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured; p-glucose (every 5 minutes), blood samples (every 30 minutes), pulse (every 5 minutes the first hour then every 10 minutes), blood pressure will be measured (the same as pulse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Study the possible difference in effect of cholinergic (physostigmine) andanticholinergic (atropine) drugs on insulin sensitivity in a lean and abdominal obese subgroup of subjects.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured; p-glucose (every 5 minutes), blood samples (every 30 minutes), pulse (every 5 minutes the first hour then every 10 minutes), blood pressure will be measured (the same as pulse).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed written informed consent
- BMI of lean and abdominally obese men and women
- weight stable
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing clinically significant diseases
- History of repeated syncope
- resting pulse<50 or systolic blood pressure <100

overall_official.affiliation: Lundberg Laboratory for diabetic research, Sahlgrenska Universitetssjukhuset Göteborg, Sweden
